title.text: Adapting SimpleNLG for Brazilian Portuguese realisation

abstractContent.text: This paper describes the ongoing implementation and the current coverage of SimpleNLG-BP, an adaptation of Simple-NLG-EnFr (Vaudry and Lapalme, 2013) for Brazilian Portuguese.

introductionContent.text: Realisation is the last step in natural language generation (NLG) systems, so the goal of a realisation engine is to output text.
SimpleNLG is a Java library that employs morphological, syntactic and orthographical operations on non-linguistic input to output well-formed sentences in English.
SimpleNLG-EnFr () is an adaptation of SimpleNLG for French.
This paper describes the current state of SimpleNLG-BP 1 , an adaptation of SimpleNLG-EnFr for realisation in Brazilian Portuguese.
